column4: i am sshed into an ubunutu machine and when i connect i am immediatly attached to a screen session, when i do ctrl+a d to detach and get a prompt, my ssh session is closed, how can i ssh in and get a prompt
What prompt do you have in the screen session?
Usually, screen will start your default shell
What do you see in the screen session?
What's wrong with this prompt?
You could try killing the screen session with "exit 1", which depending on the script behind the auto-started screen session, may drop you to the bash shell... but that's not a detachment.
Pastebin it?
And then I can have a look
Or /etc/profile, or ~/.bashrc, or /.bash_profile....
Just look at each of those for one that starts screen
none of them show screen
What is the output of "grep /etc/passwd $USER"?
Or even "echo $SHELL"
see if you can find what is starting screen with "pstree | less"
Guess there is no pstree on this system then :/
Did you exit the screen with "exit 1" yet?
Exits with an error code. If you're lucky, that will drop you to the shell
unless the server is configured to go straight to screen
nope just dropped the session window
It may be an SSH configuration
Can you view /etc/ssh/sshd_config?
go for it
